blocks.text: Cryptography is used to protect the confidentiality, integrity, and authenticity of data. It does not prevent attacks by itself, but it limits what attackers can learn or change.
Modern systems rely on cryptography for secure communication, identity verification, and safe storage of sensitive information.
Poor implementation of cryptography can be just as dangerous as not using it at all, making key management and algorithm selection critical.
Cryptography should always be combined with access controls, monitoring, and secure system design.
